content: katie degroff knits small blessings is perfect for anyone young old man woman it all works my husband wanted another hat and showed me the style he wanted i used it all to come up with this beauty we all have gobs of single skeins of fingering weight yarn laying around you could adapt this pattern for a worsted or bulky yarn you would just have to greatly reduce the number of stitches cast on make sure it s a multiple of 9 adjust your needle size to fit the weight of your yarn chosen and follow the same model for the decreases so your job is get the pattern yarn cozy spot and knit away if you have any pattern questions or comments please contact me via email sheltipap1@gmail com -or- ravelry dm sheltipap -or- www katiedegroffknits com be sure to create a project page on ravelry for your hat and tag me on instagram @sheltipap and #smallblessingshat i love to see my patterns worked up total amount of each color used materials main color m - 70gr - us size 1 5 2 5mm needles 4-5 double pointed or one to two sets of circulars stitch definitions -tapestry needle scissors k- knit -cable needle or locking stitch marker for cables p- purl -optional stitch markers 16 k2tog- knit the next two stitches together to decrease one yarn stitch - 1 100gr skein main ssk- slip the next two stitches sample uses- madelinetosh pashmina one at a time knit wise knit thunderstorm main color them together through the back loops to decrease gauge one stitch 11 row 7 stitches per inch p2tog- purl the next two stitches k2 p2 un-blocked on us size 6 needles together to decrease one stitch cluster 2/1 hold the next two stitches to the front of the work knit one place held stitches back onto your working needle and knit them ©k atie d e gr of f 20 2 2 for p e r s onal us e onl y katie degroff knits pattern co 144 stitches using your favorite method and main color m your entire hat will be worked with your m -divide your stitches across 4 double pointed needles one or two sets of circulars being careful not to twist your stitches you will now be working in the round section 1 row 1 m - k2 p2 to end repeat row 1 25 more times chart below to mark off repeats -this brim is meant to be folded over as much as you wish so feel free to work more repeats if you would like yours longer section 2 row 1- knit all row 2- k2 p2 cluster 2/1 p2 to end -optionally you could place a stitch marker between each 9-stitch repeat row 3- k2 p2 k3 p2 to end row 4- k2 p2 k3 p2 to end row 5- k2 p2 k3 p2 to end row 6- k2 p2 k3 p2 to end row 7- k2 p2
